item.title: Mozart and Epilepsy
item.description: Intro Hello and welcome! There is a growing body of research that suggests that listening to Mozart can serve as a non-invasive and non-pharmacological intervention for people suffering from intractable epilepsy (aka refractory epilepsy, aka drug-resistant epilepsy). Trouble is, scientists don’t really know how or why this happens. And if there’s two words in the english language that researchers love most, its how and why. So today, we’ll be diving into some fascinating research coming out of Dartmouth that’s just been published in Nature Scientific Reports thats minding and bridging this gap in our understanding.
